org.sakaiproject.tool.api

Interface SessionManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SessionComponent, SessionComponentTest

    public interface SessionManager

    SessionManager keeps track of Sakai-wide and Tool placement specific user sessions, modeled on the HttpSession of the Servlet API.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CURRENT_INVALID_SESSION
      Key in the ThreadLocalManager for the case where a session requested was invalid, and we started a new one.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getActiveUserCount(int secs)
      Count the number of users with sessions recently active (within the given number of seconds)
      Session getCurrentSession()
      Access the session associated with the current request or processing thread.
      String getCurrentSessionUserId()
      Access the current session's user id, or return null if there is no current session.
      ToolSession getCurrentToolSession()
      Access the tool session associated with the current request or processing thread.
      Session getSession(String sessionId)
      Access the known session with this id.
      List<Session> getSessions()
      Get all current sessions.
      String makeSessionId(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, Principal principal)
      Generate a session ID for the given request and principal
      void setCurrentSession(Session s)
      Set this session as the current one for this request processing or thread.
      void setCurrentToolSession(ToolSession s)
      Set this session as the current tool session for this request processing or thread.
      Session startSession()
      Start a new session.
      Session startSession(String id)
      Start a new session, using this session id.

        static final String CURRENT_INVALID_SESSION
        Key in the ThreadLocalManager for the case where a session requested was invalid, and we started a new one.

    • Method Detail

      • getSession

        Session getSession(String sessionId)
        Access the known session with this id.
        Returns:
        The Session object that has this id, or null if the id is not known.

      • makeSessionId

        String makeSessionId(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                   Principal principal)
        Generate a session ID for the given request and principal
        Returns:
        The session id that should be used for the given request and principal.

      • getSessions

        List<Session> getSessions()
        Get all current sessions.
        Returns:
        List of sessions.

      • startSession

        Session startSession()
        Start a new session.
        Returns:
        The new Session.

      • startSession

        Session startSession(String id)
        Start a new session, using this session id.
        Parameters:
        id - The session Id to use.
        Returns:
        The new Session.

      • getCurrentSession

        Session getCurrentSession()
        Access the session associated with the current request or processing thread.
        Returns:

      • getCurrentSessionUserId

        String getCurrentSessionUserId()
        Access the current session's user id, or return null if there is no current session.
        Returns:
        The current session's user id, or null if there is no current session or it has no user id.

      • getCurrentToolSession

        ToolSession getCurrentToolSession()
        Access the tool session associated with the current request or processing thread.
        Returns:
        The tool session associatd with the current request or processing thread.

      • setCurrentSession

        void setCurrentSession(Session s)
        Set this session as the current one for this request processing or thread.
        Parameters:
        s - The session to set as the current session.

      • setCurrentToolSession

        void setCurrentToolSession(ToolSession s)
        Set this session as the current tool session for this request processing or thread.
        Parameters:
        s - The session to set as the current tool session.

      • getActiveUserCount

        int getActiveUserCount(int secs)
        Count the number of users with sessions recently active (within the given number of seconds)
        Parameters:
        secs - Elapsed time within which sessions have been active
